channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Fallout from Venezuela’s Election
item.description: Protesters are on the streets, exasperated by a generation of leaders they can’t get rid of.

item.title: Live Updates: A Top Hamas Leader Is Killed in Iran
item.description: Hamas accused Israel of killing Ismail Haniyeh, who was in Tehran for the inauguration of Iran’s new president, though there was no response from Israel. His death raised further fears of a wider war in the region.

item.title: How Hungary’s prime minister Viktor Orbán used a sprawling media empire to dominate the nation’s democracy
item.description: The government's efforts to control media have buoyed. Hungary spent the most in the whole EU—nearly $4.8 million, on political ads on platforms owned by Meta.

item.title: More Ukrainians Appear Open to a Peace Deal
item.description: Most Ukrainians still oppose ceding any territory to Russia. But polls and recent remarks by the country’s leaders highlight a palpable shift in the conversation around peace talks.

item.title: Will the Assassination of a Hamas Leader Escalate the Risk of a Wider War?
item.description: Qatar, a main mediator in Gaza truce talks, said high-profile assassinations risk plunging the region deeper into chaos. But analysts say warring parties have little appetite for a wider war.

item.title: Boar’s Head expands listeria outbreak recall to 7 million more pounds of deli meats made in Virginia
item.description: The new recall includes 71 products made between May 10 and July 29 under the Boar's Head and Old Country brand names.

item.title: Hamas Leader Killed in Iran, and the Toll of Native Boarding Schools
Haniyeh’s Death Will Shake but Not Destroy Hamas, Analysts Say
item.description: Hamas will need to scramble to replace Ismael Haniyeh following his killing in Tehran, analysts say, but the group has recovered from past assassinations of its political and military leaders.

item.title: Navajo Nation plans to block federal highways to stop uranium from being transported on its land
item.description: Navajo President Buu Nygren vowed to carry out the plan to enact roadblocks while the tribe develops regulations over the first major shipments of uranium ore through the reservation in years.

item.title: Huw Edwards, Former BBC Anchor, Pleads Guilty to Making Indecent Images of Children
item.description: Huw Edwards, who was one of the BBC’s top television anchors, admitted to offenses in a London court on Wednesday.

item.title: India’s Deadly Landslides, Explained
item.description: The death toll has risen to at least 126 in Kerala State after heavy rain sent huge mudslides through an area known as a tourist destination.

item.title: Despite steep 38% tariffs, Stellantis begins EV rollout in Europe under Chinese joint venture
item.description: The vehicles will be sold at 200 locations in Europe by the end of this year, more than doubling to 500 by the end of 2026.

item.title: Ismail Haniyeh, a Top Hamas Leader, Is Dead at 62
item.description: Mr. Haniyeh, the militant group’s exiled political chief, was Hamas’s top negotiator in cease-fire talks to end the nearly 10-month-old war in Gaza.

item.title: More Ukrainians Appear Open to a Peace Deal
item.description: Most Ukrainians still oppose ceding any territory to Russia. But polls and recent remarks by the country’s leaders highlight a palpable shift in the conversation around peace talks.

item.title: Secret Service acting director says he is ‘ashamed’ over Trump shooting and blames agency’s ‘failure to challenge our assumptions’
item.description: Ronald Rowe Jr. also testified that he recently visited the shooting site and laid down on the roof of the building where shots were fired in order to evaluate the gunman's line of sight during the shooting in Butler, Pa.
